cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi SSW of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across the northwest Caribbean, through the Yucatán Channel into the central Gulf of Mexico and toward the northern Gulf Coast (primarily Louisiana/Mississippi).

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern U.S. Gulf Coast from the TX/LA border eastward to the Alabama coast (greatest risk centered over Louisiana).
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds (34-50 kt) are possible with a 43% cumulative probability; 19% chance of 50-kt winds as the storm passes east of the port late Sunday into Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If Ida makes landfall just east of the Texas-Louisiana border, onshore flow could raise water levels 2–4 ft above normal along the Upper Texas coast, including Sabine Pass and the Port Arthur/Beaumont waterway.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could drop 4–8 inches of rain, producing localized flash flooding in the Beaumont/Port Arthur area late Sunday through Monday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands and hazardous swell/rough seas in approaches to the port beginning late Saturday night.
